See Ill. Rev. ch. Stat. pars. 119—1 and 119—2. The language “Mittimus to be effective upon release by federal authorities” is too broad and does not clearly define what sentence the 38, imposed sentence is to follow. See Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. par. 7—1. Tobin, depicted 426 Fed.2d 1279, by in which defendant’s conviction was reversed and the cause remanded for a new trial in May 1970, and that defendant had not been reprosecuted in that cause. “A sentence should be so complete as not to require construction by the court to ascertain its import, and so complete that it will not be necessary for a nonjudicial or ministerial officer to the written supplement to People v. words ascertain its Walton meaning.” (1969), 118 Ill.App.2d 324, 254 N.E.2d 190, 194—5. affirmed, The judgment of conviction is the sentence is to modified provide a minimum sentence of seven years and a maximum of sentence twenty years; Judgment with sentence so modified is affirmed. MORAN and CREES, JJ., concur.
